item.title: War Robots Codes (March 2025)
item.description:
War Robots is a dynamic multiplayer shooter where you and other players will play as robots with different guns and skills. The higher your level, the more components, resources, and robots you will have.

To quickly level up and advance in the game, we recommend redeeming War Robots codes. The rewards from the codes will be many useful things, such as various boosters that will increase your efficiency.

Updated March 15, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Currently, there is only one active code available, granting you useful in-game boosters. Stay tuned for future updates, as more codes may be released over time.

All War Robots Codes

Working War Robots Codes

  • WARROBOTS10 - Redeem this code to get ten Defense Boosters, ten Resource Boosters, and ten Attack Boosters.

Expired War Robots Codes

  • GC-SGHQ-SEFLKI
  • GC-SREA-NBCAAO
  • warrobots999
  • WRFIRSTCODE01
  • GC-TOQZ-SKABBD
  • GC-SUDI-AMHVDJ
  • GC-HPKJ-ROOVBS

Regardless of your progress in the game, redeeming War Robots codes will always be a nice bonus. With the rewards you receive, you can level up much faster and unlock more features and robots, so be sure to take advantage of this opportunity.

How to Redeem Codes for War Robots

Redeeming War Robots codes is not difficult, and like in most mobile games, you can do it right after launching the game, even without completing the tutorial. If you don't know where to find the necessary option or don't understand how to redeem codes at all, follow the detailed guidelines below:

  • Launch War Robots .
  • Go to the main menu of the game.
  • Pay attention to the upper right corner of the screen. There will be a button with a gear icon. Click on it.
  • This will open the settings menu. Here, go to the General tab and scroll to the bottom of the menu until you see the Gift Codes section.
  • This section will contain an input field and a green Get Now button next to it. Now, enter manually or, better yet, copy and paste one of the above active codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click the green Get Now button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see a list of rewards received on the screen. If it doesn't work, make sure you didn't make any mistakes when entering the code manually, and that you didn't insert an extra space if you copied and pasted it.

How to Get More War Robots Codes

Just as is the case with Roblox codes, you can find more codes on the game's official social media, and luckily, War Robots has plenty of them. By carefully monitoring each of them, it is highly likely that you will find fresh codes, and if not, you can try again later.

  • Official War Robots Reddit account.
  • Official War Robots Facebook page.
  • Official War Robots YouTube channel.
  • Official War Robots Instagram account.

War Robots is available on PC and mobile devices.

item.title: Marvel Rivals: What is Iron Man’s Steam Power Skin Based On?
item.description:
Yet another skin has been leaked for one of Marvel Rivals ’ most popular characters. Unlike other Marvel Rivals leaks, official art for Iron Man’s new Steam Power skin has been leaked. The new Iron Man design is exciting news despite the Duelist having five costumes already. As is the case for many other interesting Marvel Rivals cosmetics, the Steam Power skin is rooted in Marvel Comics.

The 1872 Collection of costumes seems like it will continuously add more skins as Marvel Rivals progresses. Prior to Steam Power Iron Man, three costumes in the collection were added to the game throughout Season 1, including one Rare Groot skin (Carved Traveler), and two Epic skins for Rocket Raccoon (Bounty Hunter) and Black Widow (Mrs. Barnes). The Steam Power skin will be the third Epic costume in the collection, but it diverges from other costumes in the collection as its design clearly references an Iron Man design from two offbeat Marvel Comics storylines.

The Dark Ages Limited Series Features a Steam-Powered Iron Man

Marvel Comics’ Dark Ages Vol. 1 was a six-issue limited series that started in September 2021 and concluded in May 2022. The story hinges on a new villain called the Unmaker, an A.I. with powers comparable to Galactus. Slumbering beneath the Earth’s core since the primordial age, the Unmaker’s sudden appearance back online startles Earth’s mightiest heroes and leads them to form a team, as the emergence of Unmaker from under the Earth’s surface would crack the planet like an egg. Vision, Scarlet Witch, Invisible Woman, the Thing, and Doctor Strange set out to destroy the machine, with Invisible Woman being the only survivor. Before passing, Strange managed to push Unmaker back into a dormant state by opening a portal to a giant neutron star that emits an electromagnetic pulse.

The rest of Dark Ages takes place seven years after this tragic battle, with the still-open portal continuously saturating the Earth with deadly pulses from the neutron star. Science-minded superheroes end up collaborating on new inventions to help humanity live in this new, electricity-free, world. In particular, Tony Stark learns alchemy and continues to build suits. One such suit is an incredibly bulky piece of armor powered by a furnace. Thus, Steampunk Iron Man is born.

Dark Ages ’ design for the steam-powered suit is drastically different from the leaked Steam Power costume. While both costumes are bulkier than the iconic iron suits Stark and co. usually sport, the Steam Power costume leans more into the steampunk aesthetic, with gold hardware and dials. Dark Ages ’ version of the suit features a similar furnace in place where Iron Man’s arc reactor typically is, but the costume is instead bright red. The differences between the costumes could simply be because Marvel Rivals ’ design drew further inspiration from yet another Marvel Comics storyline with a steam-powered Iron Man suit.

Steam Power Iron Man Could Simply Be Inspired by the 1872 Limited Series

A four-issue series, 1872 Vol. 1 (2015), surprisingly does not serve as the inspiration for all the costumes in Marvel Rivals ’ collection of the same name. In fact, only Black Widow’s “Mrs. Barnes” costume is officially inspired by the limited series, with the name of the costume directly referencing her marriage to the Winter Soldier in this storyline. Her 1872 skin directly sets a precedent for the Steam Power suit to also be categorized as comic-based, with the “First Appearance” tag for her skin mentioning 1872 Vol. 1 (2015) #2.

If the Steam Power skin is revealed to be comic-based, it’s more likely that NetEase will choose 1872 over Dark Ages in an Occam’s razor situation. Despite this, Marvel Rivals ’ Steam Power design arguably holds more similarity with the Dark Ages ’ design than 1872 ’s. The 1872 comic design places Iron Man’s furnace on his back, with a powerful beacon filling the arc reactor spot. The comic’s design may have the same color scheme as the Marvel Rivals design, but comic fans can clearly spot inspiration from both the 1872 and Dark Ages limited series in Iron Man’s next costume.

item.title: Best Multiplayer Games That Support 64-Player Multiplayer
item.description:
Summary

  • Fortnite offers a deep sandbox with various gameplay modes, making it a popular choice for 64+ player support.
  • Battlefield 1 or 5 provide unique, large-scale combat with intense 32 vs 32 multiplayer battles.
  • New World stands out for requiring large player counts for activities like boss battles and chest runs.

Like all things technology-related, multiplayer games have come a long way since they were first introduced. Not only have things like physics simulation and graphical fidelity improved significantly since online multiplayer hit the mainstream, but they can also support more and more players. MMORPGs have been doing this for a while now, but now, more and more gaming genres are able to do the same while keeping their more complex sandbox features.

This list comprises the best games that support 64 players or more . Some of these will be newer, and some of these will be classics, but most of these will be PvP games. There are a few exceptions, but most games use the technology to make more chaotic and robust PvP environments where more and more players can square off against each other.

6 Fortnite

Hip With the Kids

This one is to be expected, but that's not to say it doesn't deserve its spot. There is a reason that this game is popular across age ranges: it's dumb, goofy, and fun, with a lot of content.

Fortnite 's biggest advantage is that its sandbox is incredibly deep. It not only offers great gameplay variety in its staple modes, but also features the ability to make tons of spinoff modes like racing or even a Valorant clone. The game is also completely free to try outside its original tower defense mode.

5 Battlefield 1 or 5

The 32 vs 32 Staple

This entry can apply to both Battlefield 1 and Battlefield 5. These games are unique even within the Battlefield lineup, as well as being the most played today. Despite the confusing nomenclature, both of these games are sequels to Battlefield 4 , making various changes that streamlined the series in unique ways.

Battlefield 1 is the simplest in the franchise, but also the most concise, sporting large-scale World War 1 combat that relies on class-based coordination. Battlefield 5 spins Battlefield 1 's formula by making ammo and health more scarce, and allowing players to build on the map to reinstate destroyed structures for cover. Both of these are decent entries in the Battlefield series, taking advantage of destructible environments to deliver 32 vs 32 multiplayer.

4 New World

Large Scale PvP and PvE

As stated above, MMOs like World of Warcraft and Everquest have been supporting high player counts for decades now, hence the "Massive" in "Massively Multiplayer." However, the reason New World specifically qualifies, as opposed to other MMOs, is due to the actual activities players do and how many players are required.

Unlike in World of Warcraft , where the max number of players required to reach the endgame is 5-20, New World has players bumping into each other in larger groups to get the best gear and the newest cosmetics. For instance, there are many holiday-themed bosses, like a giant turkey for Thanksgiving, and it's not uncommon to see large swaths of players facing them in unison. There are also "chest runs" where players band together to grab respawning world chests, and these convoys can get into the hundreds. This isn't even getting into New World 's 50v50 territorial battles, which determine the tax rates of its regions.

3 Star Wars Battlefront 2 (2005)

A Certified Classic

The original Star Wars Battlefront games are some of the most immersive Star Wars games to date, and that is because they are also the least concerned with balance. The joy of these games isn't in their competitive structures or their skill expression. It's about being absorbed into the Star Wars universe, which often means dying spectacularly. Being chased down by a little green goblin who is not only six times faster than the player, but is also six times harder to hit, is not only absurdly funny but even rewarding.

In these games, heroes can't heal unless they kill people, so players are rewarded for applying pressure to heroes at the expense of dying so long as they can out-damage their healing. This leads to battles that look and feel like those from the movies, where both parties are being rewarded, even if those opposing the heroes will probably not be alive for long.

2 Squad

50 vs 50 Milsim

Squad is a multiplayer military simulator that sports 50 vs 50 large-scale combat, complete with land, air, and amphibious vehicles. The game is slow and deliberate, but not overly complicated so long as players don’t try flying the helicopters. The frontlines in Squad are very interesting to play around, because, unlike Battlefield , the spawn points aren’t map objectives but placed by players.

Players are in control of the bases forces deploy from, but they also have to be careful. Ammo has to be manually delivered to the bases by truck drivers, or else spawning troops will spawn in nearly dry. Despite how daunting people make the genre sound, Squad is a legitimately chill game. Its community is the same, more interested in goofing around than taking things too seriously. If anyone has been sitting on a copy of this game, they should give it a go.

1 Delta Force

Worthy Battlefield Competitor

This is because Delta Force is a relatively new game in the genre. While on the surface it looks like a Battlefield 2042 clone , it honestly does a lot more right than its competitor.

From better weapon customization with faster unlock rates, to operators properly designed around teamplay and coordination, it’s interesting to one game do another game’s ideas so much better. From map design to game balance, Team Jade shows that their appreciation for the genre runs deep. Those who are fine with a tone closer to G.I. Joe than other Battlefield games will find a great competitor here.

item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard - 10 Best Weapons For Duelists
item.description:
Summary

  • Duelists in Dragon Age: The Veilguard excel at Bleeding and Necrosis attacks with weapons like rapiers and cutlasses.
  • Key weapons like Storm Needle, Dark Shard, and Antivan Rapier boost damage, penetration, and afflictions for Duelists.
  • Weapons like Bloodletter's Twinblade and Cordova's Toothpick enhance Bleeding effects and charged attacks heavily.

Duelists in Dragon Age: The Veilguard are fast Melee attackers capable of inflicting Bleeding and Necrosis with deadly precision and lightning speed. They're proficient in combat using Rapiers, Cutlasses, and Swords and use a combination of these to deliver incredible combos and shred their enemies to pieces.

With a lot of weapons to pick from, Duelists are a privileged Specialization that does not need too much Ranged Damage to succeed and overcome challenging enemies. So, here are the best Weapons for this class, including the infamous Antivan Rapier, the Focal Blade, and many more.

Updated March 16, 2025, by Lucas Simons : if players want a good reason to squeeze another playthrough of Dragon Age: The Veilguard a Rogue Duelist is just the excuse they were looking for. With deadly attacks capable of causing many status effects, unparalleled attack speed, and incredibly flashy melee combos, the Duelist is a master of the cloak and blade (sorry, no daggers for Rogues in The Veilguard). There are some meta weapons like the Focal Blade and the powerful Barbed Longsword that have been really useful as of late, especially if players combine them with artifacts that empower bleeding, staggering, and final attacks. All of the Duelist's prime characteristics are empowered by their main weapon and their off-hand, and the overall damage is not nearly as important as how many status effects they can cause to make even the stronger enemies bleed out and writhe in pain.

1 Focal Blade

Perfect For Extra Lightning Damage

  • Uncommon : Electric damage is increased by +40
  • Rare : Final Attacks have an added +100 Electric damage
  • Epic : Shocked is applied on Final Attacks
  • Legendary : Shocked status reduces an enemy's Electric Resistance by 25

If players want their Rook coming out on top of every tricky situation, empowering the Duelist capabilities to deal Lightning Damage (like all good Antivan Crows), they should look for the Focal Blade. This particular sword is obtained when players complete the quest Pinnacle of Its Kind. After that, several world chests will offer upgrades to the blade and make it even more powerful.

All that extra electric damage, plus the capability to cause Shocked with every Final Attack of a combo sequence is enticing enough to make this a primary weapon for Duelists. Combining it with the Antivan Rapier will cause tons of damage, since Shock and Necrotic damage overcome most of the resistances of several heavy enemies throughout the adventure. Duelists are experts in causing status effects like Necrosis, Bleeding, and Staggering, and adding Shocked to the Mix is quite OP. A great pick for those looking for a specialized build.

2 Storm Needle

A Reliable Option, Acquired Early On

  • Uncommon : +20% Penetration
  • Rare : Critical vs. enemies with High Health
  • Epic : Melee Critical hits ignore Defense
  • Legendary : Melee Critical hits deal 30% of the damage in an area around the target

The Storm Needle is a great Off-Hand weapon, that greatly boosts Critical damage and is optimized to reinforce Duelist builds that work around the Precision Advantage. It also increases Penetration, a stat that is quite rare in Dragon Age: The Veilguard , and serves to overcome enemies' defenses.

The Duelist Rogue can take advantage of all the extra penetration of this blade, but its most broken feature is perhaps its ability to ignore all types of Defense with each Critical.

3 Dark Shard

Powerful Against Armored Enemies

  • Uncommon : +15% Heavy attack damage
  • Rare : +25% damage vs. Armor
  • Epic : Gain Enhanced Damage when breaking an enemy’s Armor
  • Legendary : Enhanced Damage now also grants +50% damage vs. Armor and Barrier

The Dark Blade is a Main Hand weapon primed to destroy Armor and Barrier from enemies, and ideal for Heavy Charged Attacks. The Duelist has some powerful Charged Attack combos, and this blade greatly enhances its efficiency.

To make things even better, each time the Duelist breaks the enemy's armor with this weapon it gains Enhanced Damage, a buff that empowers all its attacks for a fixed amount of time. Combined with certain Duelist Traits, these Weapon Perks can turn the Rogue into a meat shredder.

4 Antivan Rapier

The Duelist Weapon Par Excellence

  • Uncommon : +15% Necrotic Resistance
  • Rare : +15% Necrotic damage
  • Epic : Critical hits apply Necrosis if not already applied
  • Legendary : Whenever Necrosis is applied to a target, instead of an affliction deal 100 Necrotic damage in an area around them

The Antivan Rapier is the Duelist weapon par excellence, with the capabilities to greatly empower Necrotic attacks (which are the basics of Duelists) and also boost all Necrotic Afflictions applied on the enemies.

To top it off, it turns Necrosis DoT into an Area Damage effect which causes Necrotic damage to every enemy surrounding the afflicted target. Complete this with one of the coolest designs of all Rogue weapons, and players will be slashing their enemies with unparalleled style.

5 Bloodletter's Twinblade

Great For Bleed Builds

  • Uncommon : +30% Charged attack damage
  • Rare : Apply Bleeding on Charged attacks while at maximum Momentum
  • Epic : +50% increased Momentum generation and Stagger vs. Bleeding enemies
  • Legendary : When Bleeding enemies attack, you do not lose Momentum or Adrenaline

The Bloodletter's Twinblade is a weapon designed to be paired with weapons that cause bleeding, like Cordova's Toothpick. It not only empowers Charged Attacks and Momentum generation but also Stagger damage against Bleeding enemies. Especially useful against end-game enemies.

Its Legendary Perk is a passive that remains in effect for as long as the Duelist has the Bloodletter equipped, and prevents Bleeding enemies attacking the Rogue from breaking the Adrenaline passive. Adrenaline buffs all damage once the Rogue completes a 10-hit combo, as long as it doesn't take damage.

6 Barbed Longsword

Causes More Stagger And Regenerates Momentum

  • Uncommon : +25% Stagger
  • Rare : deal bonus damage with Light attacks based on the enemy's Stagger meter
  • Epic : enemies require twice as long to recover their Stagger once hit with this weapon
  • Legendary : Rook gains 50 momentum with a successful Takedown

Barbed Longsword has some bonuses that help players deal with some of the most troublesome things about the Duelist, which is that it consumes momentum like crazy, way more than other Rogue specializations like Saboteurs or Veil Ranger. And, to top it off, it also has limited bonuses to light-attacks, which can be either causing extra bleeding or breaking Armor.

Extra stagger damage is always welcome, more so since the Duelist relies on chipping away the enemies health instead of dealing huge chunks of damage. Takedowns empowered by the Barbed Longsword will restore 50 Momentum, that's half the total amount of combat resource for a Rogue Rook, and that means taking down two cannon fodder enemies will ensure they can keep fighting and unleashing deadly combos.

7 Golden Grassblade

For Those Who Want To Build A Tank Duelist

  • Uncommon : +30 Defense
  • Rare : Reduce incoming damage by 5% for every missing Arrow, up to 25%
  • Epic : Weapon attacks gain +10% of your Defense as bonus damage
  • Legendary : Gain +20 Defense per active Advantage

The Golden Grassblade is an elegant elven Cutlass that is designed to be paired with weapons that generate Advantages, and since the Duelist is a master at gaining a lot of combat buffs, it also benefits from having it equipped. Having this weapon active will turn the Duelist into a Dodge-Tank of sorts.

More so if the players pair it with certain accessories and Belts that also generate Advantages, like the Twin Buckle Binding, or the Warping Wrap.

8 Cordova's Toothpick

Greatly Empowers Bleeding

  • Unique Perk 1 : +6 maximum Bleeding stacks
  • Unique Perk 2 : This weapon deals very low base damage
  • Unique Perk 3 : All hits with this weapon apply Bleeding

Cordova's Toothpick is a Cutlass designed to enhance Bleeding and pairs nicely with weapons that benefit from applying this affliction to enemies, like the Bloodletter's Twinblade. It grants six extra stacks of Bleeding to enemies (the base maximum is three, so that means a total of nine Bleeding stacks).

It also causes all hits from the blade to apply Bleeding on foes, so it's basically used for Bleed Builds, alongside the Bleeding Shard ring and other accessories.

9 Proving Steel

A Weapon To Boost Combos And Gain Momentum

  • Uncommon : +20% Charged attack damage
  • Rare : Gain Immovable on every third Charged attack
  • Epic : Generate +20% Momentum while you have Immovable
  • Legendary : While you have Immovable, you no longer lose Momentum when hit

One of the most broken weapons the Rogue has, which increases Charged Attack damage, Momentum Generation, and makes the Rogue become Immovable every third attack. This Combat advantage makes the Duelist immune to interruptions and CC, and that's incredibly useful.

The Legendary passive from this blade also grants the Rogue the ability to conserve Momentum (their main resource) even after being hit, as long as they have Immovable active. This pairs great with a Perfect Block build, or even a Combat Buff generation build.

10 Cutthroat's Sword

Perfect For Critical Builds

  • Uncommon : +20% Critical damage
  • Rare : Gain Precision on Perfect Dodge
  • Epic : +10% Precision effectiveness
  • Legendary : Gain 25% Penetration while Precision is active

The Cutthroat's Sword is another Primary Weapon focused on generating Combat Advantages. The weapon is intended to pair with the Duelist focused on the Perfect Dodge build, which will also grant Precision, making the next hit a guaranteed critical.

It also increases Precision effectiveness by a certain percentage and grants extra penetration with Precision-empowered attacks. This makes breaking enemies' defenses so much easier, more so if the Duelist has a Dodge/Critical build, which is fun to play, but extremely difficult to handle.

item.title: Bloodborne: Why You Should Start Over in 2025
item.description:
While nothing official has risen to mark the occasion, the tenth anniversary of Bloodborne has arrived. First released in North America on March 24, 2015, Bloodborne quickly gained acclaim as one of the best games FromSoftware had ever made. Even 10 years later, with Elden Ring eclipsing its sales and other FromSoftware titles like Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice winning awards, Bloodborne is still noted as some players’ favorite Souls game, and there are plenty of reasons why this is the case.

In its day, Bloodborne was already notable for being a major shake-up compared to FromSoftware's spree of fantasy Souls titles, proving that the action-RPG subgenre it pioneered can work in vastly different settings with a wide array of mechanics. The gothic Victorian streets of Yharnam have their own unique appeal that has been aspired to, but never surpassed, by other Soulslikes, and Bloodborne 's faster-paced combat remains thrilling and surprisingly accessible. Despite reaching ten years of age while staying exclusive to the PlayStation 4, Bloodborne 's strengths shine through even now, and they're worth revisiting in the current year.

The Only Way To Experience Bloodborne Is To Play It As-Is

Ironically, one of the best reasons to start a new Bloodborne save file in 2025 is because of its lack of official prospects. Sony, PlayStation, and FromSoftware have not announced any new releases, follow-ups, or major tie-in products for Bloodborne ’s tenth anniversary, and even went as far as taking down a couple of well-known Bloodborne fan projects in its lead-up. With PS4 emulation still being improved upon and too intensive for most PC owners, PS4 and PS5 remain the two places to consistently play the original Bloodborne release, but that does at least mean it's widely accessible.

Ten Years In, Bloodborne’s Community Remains Healthy And Supportive

Because of that, the tight-knit Bloodborne fandom can remain in solidarity, and can continue supporting each other’s efforts to enjoy this one-of-a-kind game. A yearly “Return To Yharnam” event is hosted by Bloodborne fans from March 24 to April 7, and it is meant to rejuvenate online play by encouraging New Game co-op and messages around Lamps. It's meant to encourage new players to jump on, as well as give veterans a chance to recapture the feeling of playing through the game the first time around. With how important a sense of community is to FromSoftware's Soulslikes, it's a great way to experience this aspect of the game so late in its life, as well as hook up with online gathering places for fans.

Bloodborne Is A Soulslike Trail-Blazer

A game like Bloodborne wouldn't be worth returning to if it didn't stand out, and fortunately, it still does. Bloodborne ’s commitment to a rare gothic aesthetic and high-speed action has inspired several notable imitators, like Thymesia and Lies of P , but Bloodborne remains consistently viewed as the complete package. Deftly weaving Bloodborne ’s gothic, Victorian, and horror motifs together would have made for a memorable setting even without a Lovecraftian twist partway through, and even without Rally healing and gun parries, Bloodborne ’s mobility would still have become a touchstone that lightweight builds as recent as Elden Ring Nightreign ’s Duchess are calling back to.

Bloodborne’s Tail-End Is Uniquely Compelling

Though Lies of P and its Overture DLC have successfully escaped Bloodborne 's shadow in some fans’ eyes, the old master still has unique advantages that its star pupils haven't grasped. Not only is Bloodborne ’s balance of themes and gameplay still altogether distinct, it has a better inherent endgame experience than most of its peers. New Game+ cycles are present as expected, but Bloodborne also boasts the Chalice Dungeons as a strong motivation for invested players to keep delving deeper. Although that aspect won't be for everyone, it's another reason why Bloodborne is worth replaying after a decade.
